entry.title: The Decorating Lessons I’ve Learned From Moving 12 Times in 12 Years
entry.content:

Self Improvement

Curated by our editorsStories to fuel your mind

The Decorating Lessons I’ve Learned From Moving 12 Times in 12 Years

Domino · 6 min

I ended up packing and unpacking a lot more boxes than I had planned.

Why disagreement is vital to advancing human understanding

Aeon · 15 min

You Can Unshrink Your Shrunken Clothes

Lifehacker · 3 min

How to Become a Master at Talking to Strangers

Entrepreneur · 19 min

There Are Three Sides to Every Argument

TED Ideas · 10 min

Popular with Pocket readersStories from across the web

5 Habits That Made Me a Millionaire by 25

Entrepreneur · 5 min

You don't need superpowers to become a millionaire. Believe me, I became one by the age of 25, and I started from very humble beginnings. When I was a teenager, I began to study rich people: their behavior and what made them more successful than other people.

Avoid these 5 phrases that make you sound passive aggressive—here's how successful people communicate

CNBC · 4 min

Today, we live in a world where business, degrees and even entire relationships are conducted behind a screen.

170 Hypothetical Questions That'll Give Your Brain a Workout

parade.com · 15 min

Chatting can quickly get boring when you stick to small talk.

7 Ways to Reset Your Relationship

The New York Times · 7 min

Experts say couples can emerge from the pandemic stronger than ever by learning from the past and looking toward the future.

6 Brain Damaging Habits You May Want to Quit

Medium · 9 min

86 billion. That’s the number of cells your brain has. Without a doubt, the gooey mass between your ears is controlling your body like nothing else. It only makes sense to spend most of our time taking care of it. But we don’t. In fact, most don’t even think the brain needs care.

Aging is inevitable, so why not do it joyfully? Here’s how

TED · 14 min

“Aging gracefully” entails walking a tightrope between a youth-obsessed society, which tells us that our value declines as we age, and a culture that says nothing is as uncool as desperation, the fervent desire for something we can’t have.

3 Daily Habits That Make Jeff Bezos More Productive Than You

Entrepreneur · 4 min

Every entrepreneur gets a limited amount of time to accomplish their life and business goals, experience fun moments and make an impact. They get a finite window to be a leader in business.

The Key to Find Time for Learning

scotthyoung.com · 5 min

At the end of the week, there may only be few hours to learn new things. How do you fit it in?

Why we remember more by reading – especially print – than from audio or video

The Conversation · 4 min

The reasons relate to a variety of factors, including diminished concentration, an entertainment mindset and a tendency to multitask while consuming digital content.

3 healthier ways to cope with criticism, disappointment and defeat

TED · 8 min

One of the most fundamental human needs is to feel like things are basically OK — that we’re not failures, that the world isn’t a horrible place, and that whatever life throws at us, we’ll be able to handle it.

The Clock-Out Cure

The Cut · 6 min

For those who can afford it, quitting has become the ultimate form of self-care.

The Revival of Stoicism

VICE · 26 min

Everyone from Silicon Valley billionaires to self-help enthusiasts is repurposing Stoicism for our modern age, with results that are good, bad, and highly indifferent.

Bad at public speaking? Use this mental trick that takes just 15 minutes, says speech expert

CNBC · 4 min

Speech anxiety is one of the most common social fears, affecting 15% to 30% of the general population. After a difficult speech or two, most of us assume that we're just shy, then hope that we'll never be forced to speak in public again.

How to Make Your Small Talk Big

The New York Times · 8 min

We are all relearning how to talk to one another, and this isn’t just because of the pandemic.

Want to build someone’s confidence? Ask for their advice

TED · 8 min

Too often, we assume the obstacle to change in others is ignorance, so we offer advice. But what if the problem is a lack of confidence?

Help! I Overheard My Fiancée Make an Awful Joke About My Dead Parents.

Slate · 11 min

Our advice columnists have heard it all over the years. Each Sunday, we dive into the Dear Prudie archives and share a selection of classic letters with our readers. Join Slate Plus for even more advice columns—your first month is only $1.

A psychologist says parents of 'exceptionally resilient and successful' kids always do these 7 things: 'Yes, some are a little intense'

CNBC · 5 min

Humans are not all equal in every way. There are a few individuals who have achieved an unparalleled mastery in their field — and they are what I call the exceptionals. Put another way, they are the 1% of the 1% of the world's most successful people.

“Friends” and the illusion of perfect adult friendships

Vox · 9 min

The TV show sold us an idealized vision of these relationships. For young adults, the real thing is far harder to find.

What Every Dad Should Keep in Mind About Parenting Humor

Fatherly · 5 min

Humor is a powerful tool in a parent's arsenal. But it's good to think about whether a dad joke is used to lighten the mood, or maintain distance.

A psychotherapist says parents who raise confident, mentally strong kids always do these 3 things when praising their children

CNBC · 3 min

As parents, we want our kids to feel good about themselves, so we try to praise them as much as possible. That's not necessarily a bad thing. Research shows that there are benefits to praising kids. A simple compliment can generate self-worth and pride.
